entry.et: French or Italian; French zéro, from Italian zero, from Medieval Latin zephirum, from Arabic ṣifr

def.dt: :the arithmetical symbol 0 or 0̸ denoting the absence of all magnitude or quantity
:the point of departure in reckoning
:the point from which the graduation of a scale (as of a thermometer) begins
:an insignificant person or thing :nonentity
:a state of total absence or neutrality
:something arbitrarily or conveniently designated zero
:of, relating to, or being a zero
:limiting vision to 50 feet (15 meters) or less
:to determine or adjust the zero of (as a rifle)
:to concentrate firepower on the exact range of usually used with in
:to adjust fire on a specific target usually used with in
:to close in on or focus attention on an objective usually used with in investigators are zeroing in on a suspect
:having each item justified on the basis of cost or need zero–based budgeting
:of, relating to, or being an investment security that is sold at a deep discount, is redeemable at face value on maturity, and that pays no periodic interest zero coupon municipal bonds
:the state or condition of lacking apparent gravitational pull :weightlessness

entry.et: from its being marked by the count of zero in a countdown

def.dt: :the hour at which a planned military operation is scheduled to start
:a time when a vital decision or decisive change must be made
:of, relating to, or being a situation (as a game or relationship) in which a gain for one side entails a corresponding loss for the other side dividing up the budget is a zero–sum game
:no-tillage
:a vector which is of zero length and all of whose components are zero
